title: Belize, Guatemala reaffirm Taiwan ties during Tsai visit
description: Belize has reaffirmed its diplomatic ties with Taiwan, the second country to do so in a week as Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen travels across Central America in an effort to shore up a dwindling number of allies

title: Reports: Syria says Israel carried out strikes on Damascus
description: Syrian state media says Israel has staged airstrikes on the southern suburbs of the Syrian capital of Damascus causing some material damage

title: Security official in Argentina punched, kicked at protest
description: Protesting bus drivers punched, kicked and threw rocks at the top law enforcement official of Buenos Aires province on Monday

title: Four maps explain how Finland could alter NATO’s security
description: The move will transform Europe’s security landscape for years to come — and further strain relations with Russia.

title: 3 found dead in hotel area of Mexico's Cancun beach resort
description: Authorities in the Mexican resort of Cancun say they have found three dead bodies in the city’s hotel zone, near the beach

title: Colombia evacuates families living near active volcano
description: Colombian officials have begun to evacuate 40 families from their homes after a volcano in the center of the country showed high levels of seismic activity that could signal an eruption in the coming days or weeks

title: At least 20 people killed in a landslide in eastern Congo
description: Authorities in Congo say at least 20 people were killed in a landslide in the country’s east

title: Death toll in Mexico migrant detention center fire up to 40
description: The death toll in a fire last week at a migrant detention center in a Mexican border city has risen to 40, after one of the injured men died while being flown to a specialized hospital in Mexico City

title: A web of trenches shows Russia fears losing Crimea
description: Satellite imagery provided to The Post by Maxar shows that Russia has recently built dozens of trenches across Crimea, which it illegally annexed in 2014.

title: UN report charges South Sudan officials of rights violations
description: A United Nations-backed panel of investigators alleges that several officials in South Sudan have perpetrated serious human rights violations and should be held accountable for their crimes, in a report released Monday

title: Drug dealer gets life for killing 9-year-old Liverpool girl
description: A drug dealer who killed a 9-year-old Liverpool girl when he tried to gun down a rival has been sentenced to life in prison for murder during an emotional hearing he refused to attend

title: Investigators skeptical of yacht’s role in Nord Stream bombing
description: Officials believe more than one vessel might have been involved in sabotaging the natural gas pipeline last year and wonder if a 50-foot sailing yacht that investigators scoured for clues could be a decoy.

title: Israel: Iran was behind drone incursion from Syria
description: The Israeli military says Iran appears to have been behind the launch of a drone that was shot down over Israeli airspace this week

title: What to know about Sanna Marin’s reelection loss, Finland’s future with NATO
description: What you need to know about Marin's election loss, her likely successor Petteri Orpo and what the results mean for Finland's relationship with Russia, Ukraine and NATO.

title: Oscar Pistorius' lawyer: 'Mistake' to deny parole, appealing
description: Oscar Pistorius’ lawyer says there was an “obvious mistake” in the process to deny him parole last week

title: Paris just voted to ban rental e-scooters. Other cities could be next.
description: E-scooter operators in Paris said the referendum makes the city an outlier. Other cities like Amsterdam and Montreal have enacted restrictions in recent years.

title: Autopsies show 30 people died from gunfire in Peru protests
description: Human rights groups have called on the Peruvian government to investigate claims of excessive force by police and soldiers during recent anti-government protests that have left 49 civilians dead

title: El grupo narcotraficante más poderoso de Colombia busca negociar la paz
description: El grupo armado, que tiene el control de una parte importante del país, quiere negociar con el gobierno.

title: Inside Colombia’s most powerful drug trafficking group — and its case for peace
description: The armed group, which has control over a significant part of the country, wants negotiations with the government.

title: 8 involved in Amsterdam heist sentenced to up to 15 years
description: Eight robbers who stole millions of euros’ worth of precious metals from an armored transport vehicle then opened fire on police in a wild car chase through Amsterdam have been convicted and handed prison sentences ranging from two to 15 years

title: Jailed US reporter's defense appeals his arrest
description: A court in the Russian capital says that lawyers for an American reporter for The Wall Street Journal arrested in Russia on espionage charges have appealed his arrest

title: Russia arrests woman in blast that killed pro-war blogger
description: Russia authorities labeled the bombing a terrorist attack and released a video of a 26-year-old antiwar activist who admitted giving a figurine to Maxim Fomin, who was killed.

title: With no peace in sight, NATO countries eye more Ukraine help
description: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg says Ukraine’s Western allies have sent the country 65 billion euros ($70 billion) in military aid to help thwart Russia’s full-scale invasion

title: Police: Man in Puerto Rico steals ambulance after accident
description: Police say that a man who was involved in a car accident Monday in Puerto Rico’s capital fled the scene in an ambulance that had arrived to help him

title: Ugandan forces take over east Congo town as M23 rebels leave
description: A spokesman for the East African regional force says that Ugandan troops took control of Bunagana, a strategic town in eastern Congo that had been in the hands of M23 rebels for more than nine months

title: Finland to join NATO Tuesday, military alliance chief says
description: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg says Finland will become the 31st member of the military alliance on Tuesday

title: Rights group urges eastern Libya to free signer, blogger
description: Human Rights Watch has urged authorities in eastern Libya to release a singer and a blogger arrested allegedly for violating a widely-criticized cybercrime law

title: Burkina Faso expels 2 French journalists, no reason given
description: Two French media outlets say their correspondents have been expelled from Burkina Faso without reason

title: France's Macron to draft bill legalizing end-of-life options
description: French President Emmanuel Macron says a new bill to be drafted this year will address end-of-life options

title: Leaders of Egypt, Saudi Arabia meet after months of tension
description: The leaders of Egypt and Saudi Arabia have met in the kingdom amid months of tension between the two regional powers

title: Romanian, German, Moldovan leaders meet in Bucharest
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will be in Romania’s capital on Monday for trilateral talks with the presidents of Romania and Moldova as the three nations look to boost ties amid Russia’s war in Ukraine

title: Jewish school principal in Australia guilty of sexual abuse
description: The former principal of a Jewish girls school in Australia was found guilty of sexually abusing two students

title: Palestinians say 2 killed in Israeli army raid in West Bank
description: Palestinian health officials say two Palestinian men were killed by Israeli troops in an army raid in the occupied West Bank city of Nablus

title: Zelenskyy to visit Warsaw to meet with Poles, Ukrainians
description: Poland’s presidential office has announced that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will pay a visit to Warsaw this week

title: Pension protests raise tension between police, demonstrators
description: French authorities see the police as protectors who ensure that citizens can peacefully protest President Emmanuel Macron’s contentious retirement age increase

title: 4 hurt in German hospital fire, suspect detained
description: Authorities say four people have been seriously hurt in an overnight fire at a hospital in Berlin, including a patient who sustained life-threatening injuries

title: Kosovo ex-president Hashim Thaci stands trial in The Hague
description: The trial of Kosovo’s ex-president and three other former high-ranking members of the Kosovo Liberation Army charged with war crimes and crimes against humanity is set to open

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russia condemns blast that killed pro-Kremlin blogger, investigating as murder
description: Vladlen Tatarsky was killed and 30 people were injured in an explosion at a cafe in St. Petersburg, according to Russian state media.

title: Papua New Guinea assesses damage after powerful earthquake
description: Disaster relief workers in Papua New Guinea are assessing the extent of damage in a remote region following a powerful magnitude 7.0 earthquake

title: 'We’ll kill you': Troops film boys' killings in Burkina Faso
description: A video in Burkina Faso showing men in military fatigues walking among the bloodied bodies of boys with their hands bound surfaced on social media in mid-February

title: 'We’ll kill you': Troops film boys' killings in Burkina Faso
description: A video in Burkina Faso showing men in military fatigues walking among the bloodied bodies of boys with their hands bound surfaced on social media in mid-February

title: Trump’s indictment fuels global concern over U.S. politics
description: The rest of the world is watching as Donald Trump becomes the first former U.S. president charged with a crime.
